entries.meaning: (medicine) A pathological aversion or sensitivity to air or the movement of air, especially as a symptom of rabies.
examples: The patient was diagnosed after displaying both aerophobia and acute hydrophobia.

entries.meaning: An aversion to fresh air, drafts or breezes.
examples: I can't understand your aerophobia on days this warm.
Many first-time flyers suffer from aerophobia, though some hide it better than others.

entries.meaning: (rare, by extension or possibly from acrophobia) Fear of heights
examples: Standing on the edge of the cliff made me realise just how much aerophobia affected me.
